required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial of Paclitaxel and Bevacizumab vs. Gemcitabine, Paclitaxel, and Bevacizumab in Advanced Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Phase II Trial of Paclitaxel and Bevacizumab Versus Gemcitabine, Paclitaxel, and Bevacizumab as First Line Treatment for Locally Advanced or Metastatic Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This study will compare the cancer response to both treatments for locally advanced or metastatic breast cancer

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline & every 2 cycles (approximately 8 weeks) of treatment to measured progressive disease (PD) & post-therapy until PD or other therapy initiated (up to 35 months)
primary_outcome.description: Response defined per Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria: Complete Response (CR)=disappearance of all target lesions; Partial Response (PR)=30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Progressive Disease=20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Stable Disease=small changes that do not meet above criteria. ORR was defined as the proportion of participants who achieved a best response of either CR or PR. ORR=number of participants with CR or PR/number of participants qualified for tumor response analysis (per-protocol population).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to measured progressive disease or death up to 35 months (tumor assessments were performed every 2 cycles during study therapy; every 2 months during post-therapy until disease progression or new anticancer treatment initiated)
secondary_outcome.description: PFS was measured from date of randomization to first date of disease progression or death from any cause. For participants not known to have died or had disease progression as of data-inclusion cut-off date, PFS duration was censored at date of last study visit prior to data-inclusion cut-off date.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to death from any cause (up to 35 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival was measured from date of randomization to date of death from any cause. For participants not known to have died as of data-inclusion cut-off date, overall survival duration was censored at date of last study visit prior to the data cut-off date.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy -Breast (FACT-B): Change From Baseline to End of Therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through 30 days post therapy follow-up (up to 35 months)
secondary_outcome.description: FACT-B measures the following domains of health-related quality of life (HR-QL): physical well-being (PWB), social/family well-being (SFWB), emotional well-being (EWB), functional well-being (FWB), & additional concerns of breast cancer (BCS). Total FACT-B scores range from 0-144, with higher scores representing better HR-QOL. Minimally important differences estimates obtained for FACT-B is 7-8 points. FACT-B was assessed at baseline (prior to start of Cycle 1 [Day 1]), prior to start of each subsequent cycle (approximately every 4 weeks) during therapy, through 30-day post therapy follow-up.

secondary_outcome.measure: Physical Well Being (PWB) Subscale: Change From Baseline to End of Therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through 30 days post therapy follow-up (up to 35 months)
secondary_outcome.description: The PWB subscale of FACT-B measures physical well-being. Total PWB scores range from 0 to 28, with higher scores representing better HR-QOL. FACT-B was assessed at baseline (prior to start of Cycle 1 [Day 1]), then prior to start of each subsequent cycle (approximately every 4 weeks) during therapy, through 30-day post therapy follow-up.

secondary_outcome.measure: Social/Family Well Being (SFWB) Subscale: Change From Baseline to End of Therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through 30 days post therapy follow-up (up to 35 months)
secondary_outcome.description: The SFWB subscale of FACT-B measures social/family well-being. Total SFWB scores range from 0 to 28, with higher scores representing better HR-QOL. FACT-B was assessed at baseline (prior to start of Cycle 1 [Day 1]), then prior to start of each subsequent cycle (approximately every 4 weeks) during therapy, through 30-day post therapy follow-up.

secondary_outcome.measure: Emotional Well Being (EWB) Subscale: Change From Baseline to End of Therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through 30 days post therapy follow-up (up to 35 months)
secondary_outcome.description: The EWB subscale of FACT-B measures emotional well-being. Total EWB scores range from 0 to 24, with higher scores representing better HR-QOL. FACT-B was assessed at baseline (prior to start of Cycle 1 [Day 1]), then prior to start of each subsequent cycle (approximately every 4 weeks) during therapy, through 30-day post therapy follow-up.

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional Well Being (FWB) Subscale: Change From Baseline to End of Therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through 30 days post therapy follow-up (up to 35 months)
secondary_outcome.description: The FWB subscale of FACT-B measures functional well-being. Total FWB scores range from 0 to 28, with higher scores representing better HR-QOL. FACT-B was assessed at baseline (prior to start of Cycle 1 [Day 1]), then prior to start of each subsequent cycle (approximately every 4 weeks) during therapy, through 30-day post therapy follow-up.

secondary_outcome.measure: Breast Cancer Subscale (BCS): Change From Baseline to End of Therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through 30 days post therapy follow-up (up to 35 months)
secondary_outcome.description: The BCS subscale of FACT-B measures additional concerns of breast cancer . Total BCS scores range from 0 to 36, with higher scores representing better HR-QOL. Minimally important differences estimates obtained for BCS is 2-3 points. FACT-B was assessed at baseline (prior to start of Cycle 1 [Day 1]), then prior to start of each subsequent cycle (approximately every 4 weeks) during therapy, through 30-day post therapy follow-up.

secondary_outcome.measure: Trial Outcome Index-Breast (TOI-B): Change From Baseline to End of Therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through 30 days post therapy follow-up (up to 35 months)
secondary_outcome.description: The TOI-B represents the total of the subscales PWB,FWB, and BCS. Total TOI-B scores range from 0 to 92, with higher scores representing better HR-QOL. Minimally important differences estimates obtained for TOI is 5-6 points. FACT-B was assessed at baseline (prior to start of Cycle 1 [Day 1]), then prior to start of each subsequent cycle (approximately every 4 weeks) during therapy, through 30-day post therapy follow-up.

arm_group.description: paclitaxel 90 milligrams per meter squared (mg/m2) administered intravenously (IV) on days 1, 8, 15 every 28 days followed by bevacizumab 10 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) administered IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days

paclitaxel 90 milligrams per meter squared (mg/m2) administered intravenously (IV) on days 1, 8, 15 every 28 days followed by gemcitabine 1500 mg/m2 IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days followed by bevacizumab 10 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) administered IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days

intervention.description: 1500 mg/m2, IV day 1 and day 15 every 28 days until complete response, disease progression or unacceptable toxicity
90 mg/m2, IV, day 1, day 8 and day 15 every 28 days until complete response, disease progression or unacceptable toxicity
10 mg/kg, IV, day 1 and day 15 every 28 days until complete response, disease progression or unacceptable toxicity

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Females diagnosed with breast cancer and the cancer has spread to distant areas of the breast or organs.
- Must be able to measure the disease by specific medical parameters
- May have received breast cancer treatment in the early stage of the disease
- May be restricted in physically strenuous activity but able to carry out light work.
- Must have adequate organ function as seen in blood test results.
Exclusion
Criteria:
- Cancer that has spread to the brain.
- Unstable heart problems
- Unstable high blood pressure.
- Breast cancer treatment after the disease has considered to spread to other areas or organs.
- Unable to agree with the requirements of the study

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 219 patients were screened; 28 patients were screen failures and were not assigned treatment.

group.title: Paclitaxel Plus Bevacizumab (PB)
group.description: paclitaxel 90 milligrams per meter squared (mg/m2) administered intravenously (IV) on days 1, 8, 15 every 28 days followed by bevacizumab 10 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) administered IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days

group.title: Paclitaxel Plus Bevacizumab Plus Gemcitabine (PB+G)
group.description: paclitaxel 90 milligrams per meter squared (mg/m2) administered intravenously (IV) on days 1, 8, 15 every 28 days followed by gemcitabine 1500 mg/m2 IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days followed by bevacizumab 10 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) administered IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days

group.title: Paclitaxel Plus Bevacizumab (PB)
group.description: paclitaxel 90 milligrams per meter squared (mg/m2) administered intravenously (IV) on days 1, 8, 15 every 28 days followed by bevacizumab 10 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) administered IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days

group.title: Paclitaxel Plus Bevacizumab Plus Gemcitabine (PB+G)
group.description: paclitaxel 90 milligrams per meter squared (mg/m2) administered intravenously (IV) on days 1, 8, 15 every 28 days followed by gemcitabine 1500 mg/m2 IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days followed by bevacizumab 10 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) administered IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Basis for Pathological Diagnosis
measure.description: Methodology used for obtaining pathological diagnosis

measure.title: Breakdown According to Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status
measure.description: ECOG Performance Status classifies patients according to their functional impairment. Scores range from 0 (Fully Active) to 5 (Death). In this study, ECOG performance status was assessed within 14 days of Visit 1. Patients were required to have a baseline ECOG Performance Status of 0 or 1 for study participation.

measure.title: Breakdown by Estrogen Receptor (ER) Status
measure.description: Breakdown of participants by ER status

measure.title: Breakdown by Human Epidermal Growth Factor (HER-2 NEU) Status
measure.description: Breakdown of participants by HER-2 NEU status

measure.title: Breakdown by Progesterone Receptor (PR) Status
measure.description: Breakdown of participants by PR status

measure.title: Breakdown of Disease-free Interval
measure.description: Breakdown by treatment arm of disease-free interval which was defined as the duration between prior adjuvant chemotherapy stop date and disease recurrence date for applicable participants who received adjuvant chemotherapy.

class.title: Less than or equal to 24 months

measure.title: Diagnosis by pathology
measure.description: Pathology of breast cancer diagnosis

measure.title: Menopausal Status
measure.description: Breakdown of menopausal status

measure.title: Presence of Visceral Metastases
measure.description: Presence of visceral metastases at baseline visit

measure.title: Prior Biological Treatment for This Cancer
measure.description: Number of participants, by treatment arm, who had received prior biological treatment for this cancer. NOTE: The total number of participants who received prior biological treatment does not equal the total number of participants in the trial because not all participants received prior biological treatment.

measure.title: Prior Cancer Surgery
measure.description: Number of participants, by treatment arm, who underwent prior surgery. NOTE: The total number of participants who underwent prior surgery does not equal the total number of participants in the trial because not all participants underwent prior surgery.

measure.title: Prior Chemotherapy for This Cancer
measure.description: Number of participants, by treatment arm, who received prior chemotherapy for this cancer. NOTE: The total number of participants who received prior chemotherapy does not equal the total number of participants in the trial because not all participants received prior chemotherapy.

measure.title: Prior Exposure to Taxanes
measure.description: Number of participants previously treated with taxane chemotherapy including: Taxol (paclitaxel), Topotecan (docetaxel), or Abraxane (albumin-bound paclitaxel).

measure.title: Prior Hormonal Treatment for This Cancer
measure.description: Number of participants, by treatment arm, who received prior hormonal treatment for this cancer. NOTE: The total number of participants who received prior hormonal treatment does not equal the total number of participants in the trial because not all participants received prior hormonal treatment.

measure.title: Prior Immunological Treatment for This Cancer
measure.description: Number of participants, by treatment arm, who received prior immunological treatment for this cancer. NOTE: The total number of participants who received prior immunnological treatment does not equal the total number of participants in the trial because not all participants received prior immunological treatment.

measure.title: Prior Radiotherapy
measure.description: Number of participants, by treatment arm, who received prior radiotherapy. NOTE: The total number of participants who received prior radiotherapy does not equal the total number of participants in the trial because not all participants received prior radiotherapy.

measure.title: Body Surface Area (BSA) at Day 1 of Visit 1

outcome.title: Overall Response Rate (ORR)
outcome.description: Response defined per Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria: Complete Response (CR)=disappearance of all target lesions; Partial Response (PR)=30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Progressive Disease=20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Stable Disease=small changes that do not meet above criteria. ORR was defined as the proportion of participants who achieved a best response of either CR or PR. ORR=number of participants with CR or PR/number of participants qualified for tumor response analysis (per-protocol population).
outcome.time_frame: baseline & every 2 cycles (approximately 8 weeks) of treatment to measured progressive disease (PD) & post-therapy until PD or other therapy initiated (up to 35 months)
outcome.population: Per-protocol population included intent-to-treat participants who met the following criteria: histological or cytological breast cancer diagnosis; baseline presence of measurable disease per RECIST; at least 1 dose of study drug; no current systemic anti-tumor therapy except protocol-specified therapy. One PB+G participant did not qualify.

group.title: Paclitaxel Plus Bevacizumab (PB)
group.description: paclitaxel 90 milligrams per meter squared (mg/m2) administered intravenously (IV) on days 1, 8, 15 every 28 days followed by bevacizumab 10 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) administered IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days

group.title: Paclitaxel Plus Bevacizumab Plus Gemcitabine (PB+G)
group.description: paclitaxel 90 milligrams per meter squared (mg/m2) administered intravenously (IV) on days 1, 8, 15 every 28 days followed by gemcitabine 1500 mg/m2 IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days followed by bevacizumab 10 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) administered IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days

measure.title: Overall Response Rate (ORR)
measure.description: Response defined per Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria: Complete Response (CR)=disappearance of all target lesions; Partial Response (PR)=30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Progressive Disease=20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Stable Disease=small changes that do not meet above criteria. ORR was defined as the proportion of participants who achieved a best response of either CR or PR. ORR=number of participants with CR or PR/number of participants qualified for tumor response analysis (per-protocol population).
measure.population: Per-protocol population included intent-to-treat participants who met the following criteria: histological or cytological breast cancer diagnosis; baseline presence of measurable disease per RECIST; at least 1 dose of study drug; no current systemic anti-tumor therapy except protocol-specified therapy. One PB+G participant did not qualify.

analysis.groups_desc: Assuming the response rate for the PB arm is 34% and the addition of gemcitabine will improve it to 54%, then a sample size of 170 evaluable participants (85 per arm) will give an 80% statistical power to detect the difference, using a 1-sided test at the significance level of 0.05. Confidence levels are exact binomial 95% Confidence Intervals.
analysis.p_value_desc: Statistical significance at 0.05 level was required.

outcome.title: Progression-free Survival (PFS)
outcome.description: PFS was measured from date of randomization to first date of disease progression or death from any cause. For participants not known to have died or had disease progression as of data-inclusion cut-off date, PFS duration was censored at date of last study visit prior to data-inclusion cut-off date.
outcome.time_frame: baseline to measured progressive disease or death up to 35 months (tumor assessments were performed every 2 cycles during study therapy; every 2 months during post-therapy until disease progression or new anticancer treatment initiated)
outcome.population: ITT population=all randomized participants, eligible & ineligible. Participants with events: PB=74; PB+G=72. Censored participants: PB=20 PB+G=21.

group.title: Paclitaxel Plus Bevacizumab (PB)
group.description: paclitaxel 90 milligrams per meter squared (mg/m2) administered intravenously (IV) on days 1, 8, 15 every 28 days followed by bevacizumab 10 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) administered IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days

group.title: Paclitaxel Plus Bevacizumab Plus Gemcitabine (PB+G)
group.description: paclitaxel 90 milligrams per meter squared (mg/m2) administered intravenously (IV) on days 1, 8, 15 every 28 days followed by gemcitabine 1500 mg/m2 IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days followed by bevacizumab 10 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) administered IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days

measure.title: Progression-free Survival (PFS)
measure.description: PFS was measured from date of randomization to first date of disease progression or death from any cause. For participants not known to have died or had disease progression as of data-inclusion cut-off date, PFS duration was censored at date of last study visit prior to data-inclusion cut-off date.
measure.population: ITT population=all randomized participants, eligible & ineligible. Participants with events: PB=74; PB+G=72. Censored participants: PB=20 PB+G=21.

outcome.title: Overall Survival
outcome.description: Overall survival was measured from date of randomization to date of death from any cause. For participants not known to have died as of data-inclusion cut-off date, overall survival duration was censored at date of last study visit prior to the data cut-off date.
outcome.time_frame: baseline to death from any cause (up to 35 months)
outcome.population: Intent-To-Treat (ITT) population=all randomized participants, eligible & ineligible. Number of participants with events: PB=35; PB+G=34. Censored participants: PB=59;PB+G=59.

group.title: Paclitaxel Plus Bevacizumab (PB)
group.description: paclitaxel 90 milligrams per meter squared (mg/m2) administered intravenously (IV) on days 1, 8, 15 every 28 days followed by bevacizumab 10 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) administered IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days

group.title: Paclitaxel Plus Bevacizumab Plus Gemcitabine (PB+G)
group.description: paclitaxel 90 milligrams per meter squared (mg/m2) administered intravenously (IV) on days 1, 8, 15 every 28 days followed by gemcitabine 1500 mg/m2 IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days followed by bevacizumab 10 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) administered IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days

measure.title: Overall Survival
measure.description: Overall survival was measured from date of randomization to date of death from any cause. For participants not known to have died as of data-inclusion cut-off date, overall survival duration was censored at date of last study visit prior to the data cut-off date.
measure.population: Intent-To-Treat (ITT) population=all randomized participants, eligible & ineligible. Number of participants with events: PB=35; PB+G=34. Censored participants: PB=59;PB+G=59.

outcome.title: Total Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy -Breast (FACT-B): Change From Baseline to End of Therapy
outcome.description: FACT-B measures the following domains of health-related quality of life (HR-QL): physical well-being (PWB), social/family well-being (SFWB), emotional well-being (EWB), functional well-being (FWB), & additional concerns of breast cancer (BCS). Total FACT-B scores range from 0-144, with higher scores representing better HR-QOL. Minimally important differences estimates obtained for FACT-B is 7-8 points. FACT-B was assessed at baseline (prior to start of Cycle 1 [Day 1]), prior to start of each subsequent cycle (approximately every 4 weeks) during therapy, through 30-day post therapy follow-up.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline through 30 days post therapy follow-up (up to 35 months)
outcome.population: Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF) for all ITT patients with valid baseline and at least one valid post-baseline assessment

group.title: Paclitaxel Plus Bevacizumab (PB)
group.description: paclitaxel 90 milligrams per meter squared (mg/m2) administered intravenously (IV) on days 1, 8, 15 every 28 days followed by bevacizumab 10 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) administered IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days

group.title: Paclitaxel Plus Bevacizumab Plus Gemcitabine (PB+G)
group.description: paclitaxel 90 milligrams per meter squared (mg/m2) administered intravenously (IV) on days 1, 8, 15 every 28 days followed by gemcitabine 1500 mg/m2 IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days followed by bevacizumab 10 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) administered IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days

measure.title: Total Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy -Breast (FACT-B): Change From Baseline to End of Therapy
measure.description: FACT-B measures the following domains of health-related quality of life (HR-QL): physical well-being (PWB), social/family well-being (SFWB), emotional well-being (EWB), functional well-being (FWB), & additional concerns of breast cancer (BCS). Total FACT-B scores range from 0-144, with higher scores representing better HR-QOL. Minimally important differences estimates obtained for FACT-B is 7-8 points. FACT-B was assessed at baseline (prior to start of Cycle 1 [Day 1]), prior to start of each subsequent cycle (approximately every 4 weeks) during therapy, through 30-day post therapy follow-up.
measure.population: Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF) for all ITT patients with valid baseline and at least one valid post-baseline assessment

analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA model included treatment arm and baseline assessment.

outcome.title: Physical Well Being (PWB) Subscale: Change From Baseline to End of Therapy
outcome.description: The PWB subscale of FACT-B measures physical well-being. Total PWB scores range from 0 to 28, with higher scores representing better HR-QOL. FACT-B was assessed at baseline (prior to start of Cycle 1 [Day 1]), then prior to start of each subsequent cycle (approximately every 4 weeks) during therapy, through 30-day post therapy follow-up.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline through 30 days post therapy follow-up (up to 35 months)
outcome.population: Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF) for all ITT patients with valid baseline and at least one valid post-baseline assessment

group.title: Paclitaxel Plus Bevacizumab (PB)
group.description: paclitaxel 90 milligrams per meter squared (mg/m2) administered intravenously (IV) on days 1, 8, 15 every 28 days followed by bevacizumab 10 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) administered IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days

group.title: Paclitaxel Plus Bevacizumab Plus Gemcitabine (PB+G)
group.description: paclitaxel 90 milligrams per meter squared (mg/m2) administered intravenously (IV) on days 1, 8, 15 every 28 days followed by gemcitabine 1500 mg/m2 IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days followed by bevacizumab 10 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) administered IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days

measure.title: Physical Well Being (PWB) Subscale: Change From Baseline to End of Therapy
measure.description: The PWB subscale of FACT-B measures physical well-being. Total PWB scores range from 0 to 28, with higher scores representing better HR-QOL. FACT-B was assessed at baseline (prior to start of Cycle 1 [Day 1]), then prior to start of each subsequent cycle (approximately every 4 weeks) during therapy, through 30-day post therapy follow-up.
measure.population: Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF) for all ITT patients with valid baseline and at least one valid post-baseline assessment

analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA model included treatment arm and baseline assessment.

outcome.description: The SFWB subscale of FACT-B measures social/family well-being. Total SFWB scores range from 0 to 28, with higher scores representing better HR-QOL. FACT-B was assessed at baseline (prior to start of Cycle 1 [Day 1]), then prior to start of each subsequent cycle (approximately every 4 weeks) during therapy, through 30-day post therapy follow-up.

group.title: Paclitaxel Plus Bevacizumab (PB)

measure.title: Functional Well Being (FWB) Subscale: Change From Baseline to End of Therapy
measure.description: The FWB subscale of FACT-B measures functional well-being. Total FWB scores range from 0 to 28, with higher scores representing better HR-QOL. FACT-B was assessed at baseline (prior to start of Cycle 1 [Day 1]), then prior to start of each subsequent cycle (approximately every 4 weeks) during therapy, through 30-day post therapy follow-up.
measure.population: Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF) for all ITT patients with valid baseline and at least one valid post-baseline assessment

analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA model included treatment arm and baseline assessment.

outcome.title: Breast Cancer Subscale (BCS): Change From Baseline to End of Therapy
outcome.description: The BCS subscale of FACT-B measures additional concerns of breast cancer . Total BCS scores range from 0 to 36, with higher scores representing better HR-QOL. Minimally important differences estimates obtained for BCS is 2-3 points. FACT-B was assessed at baseline (prior to start of Cycle 1 [Day 1]), then prior to start of each subsequent cycle (approximately every 4 weeks) during therapy, through 30-day post therapy follow-up.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline through 30 days post therapy follow-up (up to 35 months)
outcome.population: Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF) for all ITT patients with valid baseline and at least one valid post-baseline assessment

group.title: Paclitaxel Plus Bevacizumab (PB)
group.description: paclitaxel 90 milligrams per meter squared (mg/m2) administered intravenously (IV) on days 1, 8, 15 every 28 days followed by bevacizumab 10 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) administered IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days

group.title: Paclitaxel Plus Bevacizumab Plus Gemcitabine (PB+G)
group.description: paclitaxel 90 milligrams per meter squared (mg/m2) administered intravenously (IV) on days 1, 8, 15 every 28 days followed by gemcitabine 1500 mg/m2 IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days followed by bevacizumab 10 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) administered IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days

measure.title: Breast Cancer Subscale (BCS): Change From Baseline to End of Therapy
measure.description: The BCS subscale of FACT-B measures additional concerns of breast cancer . Total BCS scores range from 0 to 36, with higher scores representing better HR-QOL. Minimally important differences estimates obtained for BCS is 2-3 points. FACT-B was assessed at baseline (prior to start of Cycle 1 [Day 1]), then prior to start of each subsequent cycle (approximately every 4 weeks) during therapy, through 30-day post therapy follow-up.
measure.population: Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF) for all ITT patients with valid baseline and at least one valid post-baseline assessment

analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA model included treatment arm and baseline assessment.

outcome.title: Trial Outcome Index-Breast (TOI-B): Change From Baseline to End of Therapy
outcome.description: The TOI-B represents the total of the subscales PWB,FWB, and BCS. Total TOI-B scores range from 0 to 92, with higher scores representing better HR-QOL. Minimally important differences estimates obtained for TOI is 5-6 points. FACT-B was assessed at baseline (prior to start of Cycle 1 [Day 1]), then prior to start of each subsequent cycle (approximately every 4 weeks) during therapy, through 30-day post therapy follow-up.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline through 30 days post therapy follow-up (up to 35 months)
outcome.population: Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF) for all ITT patients with valid baseline and at least one valid post-baseline assessment

group.description: paclitaxel 90 milligrams per meter squared (mg/m2) administered intravenously (IV) on days 1, 8, 15 every 28 days followed by gemcitabine 1500 mg/m2 IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days followed by bevacizumab 10 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) administered IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days

measure.title: Trial Outcome Index-Breast (TOI-B): Change From Baseline to End of Therapy
measure.description: The TOI-B represents the total of the subscales PWB,FWB, and BCS. Total TOI-B scores range from 0 to 92, with higher scores representing better HR-QOL. Minimally important differences estimates obtained for TOI is 5-6 points. FACT-B was assessed at baseline (prior to start of Cycle 1 [Day 1]), then prior to start of each subsequent cycle (approximately every 4 weeks) during therapy, through 30-day post therapy follow-up.
measure.population: Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF) for all ITT patients with valid baseline and at least one valid post-baseline assessment

analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA model included treatment arm and baseline assessment.

reported_events.desc: Adverse events (AEs) provided for all patients who received at least one dose of study drug. AEs are both study-drug related and non-study drug related. AEs represent all grades (1-5). Grade 1: mild adverse event (AE); Grade 2: moderate AE; Grade 3: severe AE; Grade 4: life-threatening or disabling AE; Grade 5: death-related to AE.

group.title: Paclitaxel Plus Bevacizumab (PB)
group.description: paclitaxel 90 milligrams per meter squared (mg/m2) administered intravenously (IV) on days 1, 8, 15 every 28 days followed by bevacizumab 10 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) administered IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days

group.title: Paclitaxel Plus Bevacizumab Plus Gemcitabine (PB+G)
group.description: paclitaxel 90 milligrams per meter squared (mg/m2) administered intravenously (IV) on days 1, 8, 15 every 28 days followed by gemcitabine 1500 mg/m2 IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days followed by bevacizumab 10 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) administered IV on days 1 and 15 every 28 days

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Of 191 randomized patients, 4 patients were disqualified from inclusion in any efficacy or safety analyses due to significant Good Clinical Practice (GCP) violations; data is reported for the remaining 187 randomized patients.
